translation:
Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir

Yesterday Cruz came and said that Bento Manuel went to Piratini and the guns to Rio Pardo, and in Triunfo is Captain Augusto with all gathered, old men, children, and disabled, having 160 cavalrymen, 40 infantry under the command of Felisberto, brother of Simas, and they say they will withdraw for these six or eight days; the sending of the guns to Rio Pardo is confirmed by Corporal José João de Castro who was a prisoner in Rio Pardo, and came yesterday from Santo Amaro; and Your Excellency Major Simas and Mombaque and wanting also can go to Oliveira’s people. Cruz is ready waiting for orders to proceed; this is what I have to inform Your Excellency for now.

God keep Your Excellency  
Camp of Picada, November 18, 1838.  
Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir Tomás José da Silva.  
Francisco Pedro de Abreu.  
Major Commander of the Detachment of Picada.

Mombaque is a corruption of Mombach.
